The Experience of a Lifetime

Looking for a gastronomical retreat where you are immersed in the mysticism of Balinese culture?

Tresna Bali Culinary and Culture Retreats (CulCul Retreats)

CulCul is a play on words. “KulKul” is the traditional Balinese communication system in every village centre. When it rings, everyone knows immediately what it means. There are different sounds for different needs - one rhythm to announce the beginning of a ceremony, another urgent banging to get your bucket to help with a fire! As a Balinese, you grow up knowing exactly what each sound is in your village. However, you’ll be lost if you go into the next village as the sounds are different.

Tourists visiting Bali often have a hard time learning about the “real Bali”. Although the Balinese are beyond friendly and caring, due to language and cultural differences, it is very challenging for them to explain their way of life to tourists. You’re not on the same “KulKul” system.

With our CulCul Retreats, you’ll have your very own “KulKul”. With me, you’ll gain an inside perspective of Bali’s sacred culture and food. I’ve lived here for 19 years. Adi and I built one of Bali’s most exclusive travel and wedding agencies (making upmarket clients happy) while living in a Balinese family compound (making Balinese In-Laws happy)!

I am Bali’s only Holyperson from outside of Bali - through a remarkable 6-year process from 2010-2016. For the first time, I’ll openly share my personal journey with you. We’ll spend 6 magical days together where you’ll enjoy unique experiences that I’ve curated for well-travelled foodies.

Our culinary and cultural retreat, CulCul Retreats, is reserved for only 8 special guests. My team and I’ll take care of you personally throughout your stay.

Get Early Bird Pricing before July 13, 2019!

Behind Bali's Walls

Even if you have been to Bali 20 times before, with this unique retreat, you’ll experience authentic local flavours, traverse the natural landscape, and embrace what it means to be truly Balinese and a chef at heart.

Without a doubt, Bali is beautiful and the Balinese are a loving and peaceful society.  However, the majority of Balinese locals have difficulty describing the rich culture behind the walls of their family compounds.

You’ll experience a Bali that is rarely shared with visitors as you learn about my devotion to Balinese Temple life and my passionate love affair with the best food on the island.

Your Spectacular Stay

For my CulCul retreats, I’ve chosen the very best resort for your stay, giving you the privacy of your own room, suite or villa, while indulging in the intimate service of a gorgeous boutique 5-star hotel.

COMO Uma Ubud is my favourite hotel in all of Bali. As an upmarket travel agent and wedding planner for 15 years in Bali, I’m intimately familiar with every 5-star resort and villa on the island.

Located in the charming village of Ubud in a beautiful tropical river ravine setting, COMO Uma Ubud is your luxurious home for the duration of our 6-day retreat. The center of Ubud village is just 3 minutes drive or 15 minutes walk away!

You’ll be completely at home at COMO Uma Ubud. The gracious Balinese staff will remember the way you like your coffee on your 2nd morning!

  • Discover rural Bali on morning treks through rice fields and local village.
  • Stretch out in daily yoga classes, taught by Balinese Yogis trained by COMO Shambhala. Imagine yourself doing Warrior 2 overlooking a river gorge!
  • On your first evening, I’ll teach you how to make your own Balinese Ceremonial Offering, followed by our Welcome Dinner. You’ll meet new friends over our custom menu of Indonesian favourites at Kemiri.
  • Over the next 6 days, you’ll completely unravel with 75-minute Signature COMO Massages. Of course, we wouldn’t leave you hanging so you get TWO massages during your stay! Indulge further as Uma Ubud’s on-site spa offers a multitude of COMO Shambhala treatments in 6 lovely spa rooms set around the coy ponds.
  • Uma boasts a 25m swimming pool great for laps, in a beautiful tropical garden setting. Situated at one end is Uma’s Pool Bar – an open-air lounge area to hang out, enjoy a tropical cocktail, play board games and relax.

For more information, visit the COMO Uma Ubud Official Site.
